title: Blaže Georgioski
text:
Blaže Georgioski (<a href="Macedonian%20Cyrillic">Macedonian Cyrillic</a>: Блаже Георгиоски; born 1 December 1975, in <a href="Prilep">Prilep</a>) is a <a href="Macedonia%20%28country%29">Macedonian</a> retired <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player.
Club career.
Born in <a href="Prilep">Prilep</a>, he started his career in 1994 in his home town club <a href="FK%20Pobeda">FK Pobeda</a>. In 1998, he moved to <a href="Serbia">Serbia</a> to play in FK Sartid, club nowadays called <a href="FK%20Smederevo">FK Smederevo</a>. His good exhibitions make him move to the giants European 1991 Champions <a href="FK%20Crvena%20Zvezda">FK Crvena Zvezda</a> where he won the Championship in the season 1999–2000. After having returned to play again in Pobeda Prilep, in 2006 he moved to <a href="Australia">Australia</a> to play in the <a href="Victorian%20Premier%20League%202009">Victorian Premier League</a> club <a href="Preston%20Lions%20FC">Preston Lions FC</a>, where he played for 2 years winning the VPL final for Preston Lions in 2007.
International career.
Since his good exhibitions with Red Star that Georgioski started receiving calls to the <a href="Macedonia%20national%20football%20team">national squad</a>. He made his senior debut for <a href="Macedonia%20national%20football%20team">Macedonia</a> in a February 2000 <a href="friendly%20match">friendly match</a> against <a href="Yugoslavia%20national%20football%20team">Yugoslavia</a> and has earned a total of 7 caps, scoring no goals. His final international was a November 2005 friendly against <a href="Iran%20national%20football%20team">Iran</a>.
